tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE communications (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    sender_id INT,
    receiver_id INT,
    message TEXT,
    sent_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE Employee (
	employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	employee_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
	employee_position VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
	employee_department_id INT,
	FOREIGN KEY (employee_department_id) REFERENCES Department(department_id)
);

CREATE TABLE CommunicationLog (
	log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	log_date DATE NOT NULL,
	log_description TEXT,
	employee_id INT,
	FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES Employee(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE employee (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    last_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    department_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department(department_id)
);

CREATE TABLE message (
    message_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sender_id INT,
    receiver_id INT,
    message_text TEXT NOT NULL,
    message_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (sender_id) REFERENCES employee(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (receiver_id) REFERENCES employee(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE notification (
    notification_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    receiver_id INT,
    notification_text TEXT NOT NULL,
    notification_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (receiver_id) REFERENCES employee(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Communication (
    communication_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sender_id INT,
    receiver_id INT,
    message TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (sender_id) REFERENCES Employee(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (receiver_id) REFERENCES Employee(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE CommunicationLog (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    communication_id INT,
    action_taken TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (communication_id) REFERENCES Communication(communication_id)
);
